Sync to 2021.4

```
LICENSE = "DMTF-COPYRIGHT"
LICENSE = "DMTF-COPYRIGHT"
LIC_FILES_CHKSUM = "file://DSP8010_${PV}.pdf;md5=629fa6b338287a1a901b6a615934ac24"



SRC_URI = "https://www.dmtf.org/sites/default/files/standards/documents/DSP8010_${PV}.zip"

SRC_URI[md5sum] = "2572edeb96268ff6cdd41cbe1354c255"
SRC_URI[sha1sum] = "9c2cf10cc433e5e8beae074a204fd3083e23a46f"
SRC_URI[sha256sum] = "88534f1ec24943fea67ec7b329ebfee8d513de4fd48dfd1d743ce218e76090fe"
SRC_URI[sha384sum] = "036495338a96109b20dfd7401cc6d37566501bb3fddaf76570f2834fc64a2104dff5c7b936b27f2b4c344f1436e806a5"
SRC_URI[sha512sum] = "af26cb16f35be570965e01bdfc14ca650a43ac200dddb86dd771ddbf132e2625915c415fa0a4856d05330db65189e75abc58f5c4a230a0613a65c26fad811046"

inherit allarch

S = "${WORKDIR}"

FILES:${PN} += "${libdir}/redfish-schema-pack.zip"

do_install () {
    install -d ${D}${libdir}
    cp -R --no-dereference --preserve=mode,links -v ${S}/csdl ${D}${libdir}/redfish-schema-pack/
    cp -R --no-dereference --preserve=mode,links -v ${S}/openapi ${D}${libdir}/redfish-schema-pack/
}

```

Does it have to be csdl and openapi? What about `json-schema`?

I forgot json schema existed, we could probably add that to, although it's not super useful, bmcweb doesn't use it, and all the tools rely on CSDL.  This commit predates 2021.4, and yes, it should be updated.
Done. I have cleaned updated in the change. I didn't include json_schema since we don't really use it.

This will need to be updated to something like

```
[Tool]
Version = 2
Copyright = Redfish DMTF (c) 2021
verbose = 

[Host]
ip = http://localhost:8000
username = root
password = 0penBmc
description = Test Config, place your own description of target system here
forceauth = True
authtype = Basic
token = 

[Validator]
payload = 
logdir = /var/log/redfish-service-validator
oemcheck = True
debugging = False
schema_directory = /usr/lib/redfish-schema-pack


```

> http://

http is specific to your system you're on.  Upstream runs ssl by default, and so far as I know, on every upstream system.


For the rest of it, can you actually call out the diffs?  You've omitted a bunch of the file, which makes it not immediately applyable to this patch, so it's tough to see what you changed.  Some things you changed need responded to directly, for example, you used Basic auth, which is an anti pattern for running the validator, and shouldn't be done here, but there's nowhere to comment that when you leave bulk comments at the top.

I have cleaned it up a bit to match what we had in here before. The existing options should all match.

It only provided the number of options in https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Service-Validator/blob/bb087bf3aa3caaca7366cd1062a1bcb95025579c/common/config.py#L11-L15

Seems like a lot of the old ones are gone.
Cool

Just adding some notes on things to do to sync up to `47dbbb304e9af6d576f28548e62bf9a07ec53a1e` (Mostly so I don't loose it).

I didn't want to override this for now.


The build and validator run now, but failing somewhere else. Will need to see why that is the case.

```
Target URI: http://localhost:80
authtype: Basic
config: /etc/redfish-service-validator/openbmc_config.ini
debugging: False
forceauth: True
ip: http://localhost:80
logdir: /var/log/redfish-service-validator
oemcheck: True
password: ******
schema_directory: /usr/lib/redfish-schema-pack
uricheck: False
username: root
verbose: 1
Start time: 01/01/70 - 00:04:19

Setting up service...
Exception caught while creating Service
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/redfish-service-validator/RedfishServiceValidator.py", line 124, in main
    currentService = traverse.rfService(vars(args))
  File "/usr/lib/redfish-service-validator/common/traverse.py", line 45, in __init__
    self.catalog = catalog.SchemaCatalog(self.config['metadatafilepath'])
  File "/usr/lib/redfish-service-validator/common/catalog.py", line 104, in __init__
    schema = SchemaDoc(f.read(), self, my_name)
  File "/usr/lib/redfish-service-validator/common/catalog.py", line 181, in __init__
    reftags = edmxTag.find_all("edmx:Reference", recursive=False)
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find_all'
Service could not be started: AttributeError("'NoneType' object has no attribute 'find_all'")

```
If you have things to update this that you've already done locally (like updating the schema pack), feel free to push changes to this review.  I won't be offended.

Updated and tested. Seems to work for now.

Also seems like we now have *.ymal files in the folder that I removed to about the error above.
I'm pretty sure this thread has run its course.  THe latest code doesn't seem to have the above problem.

Need to add redfish-library_3.1.1.bb

```
SUMMARY = "DMTF Redfish Library"
HOMEPAGE = "https://github.com/DMTF/python-redfish-library"
LICENSE = "BSD"
LIC_FILES_CHKSUM = "file://LICENSE.md;md5=cee7a7694b5bf14bc9d3e0fbe78a64af"

SRC_URI[md5sum] = "9b470d56a07d521b6a439f8651d84535"
SRC_URI[sha256] = "eef72d11b6d6a79073eea8f2832881e14464cb964b8d87313410c064d8bcadd0"

PYPI_PACKAGE = "redfish"

inherit pypi
inherit setuptools3

BBCLASSEXTEND = "native nativesdk"

```
Done

```
RDEPENDS:${PN} = "\
    python3-lxml \
    python3-beautifulsoup4 \
    python3-requests-toolbelt \
    redfish-schema-pack \
    redfish-library \  
"
```
Done
yeah, looks like they moved some files around.  I really dislike that this calls out every file.  I wonder if we'd be better off with wildcards.
I guess we can go wildcards if they don't put random python files, but maybe this is fine for now.

Alternatively we could just copy the whole folder into somewhere in lib and symlink the required things into /usr/bin

In a perfect world, we'd fix their package to make it pip installable.

> In a perfect world, we'd fix their package to make it pip installable.

Yes.  If the upstream is garbage and doesn't properly package, we should try to contribute that upstream.  I've done the same thing for other packages, like libunifex.

Yep.  I started there, spent a couple hours on it and couldn't make it work.  I need to get back at some point.  I have a couple github bugs out against various weird packaging things that they do that are sub-optimal.
Done
Can we drop the md5sum one?  Doesn't seem to provide much benefit.
ACK.  "devtool add" generates all of these, but I've never really understood why.
Is this suppose to be 'sha256sum'?

devtool add did this one as well.  I see a couple openembedded recipies that use sha256, so maybe the lookup is fuzzier than we think?  With that said, yeah, I can change this to be more consistent.

ACK.
Yikes.  Can we pick one?
ACK.  devtool add again.
Does this need native or is native implied by allarch?

My understanding was that allarch was a more strict form than native, ie "the binaries produced by this recipe are common for all targets" which, because this is basically just installing some files, seems true.

Considering that I'd like the ability to install these files on the BMC, I don't think native would apply here, or maybe I'm not understanding what native means.  I thought it meant "just for the build machine".

oh wait. there is only yaml files in here. If I install the yaml file in that folder it will fail. Not sure why it didn't fail before.

Should we just install the `xml` files in csdl?

by "just" I'm assuming you mean "don't install the openapi"?

For some reason I thought there were tools that used openapi, hence why I installed them, but I don't recall which tools they are at the moment.
yeah, I believe there are only yaml files in openapi. Don't think there are any tools in it.

`branch=...;protocol=https`

protocol=ssh requires keys which is bad for automation.
ACK
Still open;  Will fix this when the PR gets accepted in DMTF.
Done.  PR was accepted by DMTF today.
trailing whitespace

I would like to go on record and official blame Willy for this one;  My original patch didn't have this whitespace issue.  😊

ACK will fix.
oops. should I push a patch to fix it, or are you pushing one?

Probably doesn't make sense to push a patch to fix JUST the whitespace issue.  I'm not going to look at this until late next week at the earliest, so whomever makes improvements to this next can just fix the whitespace as part of the next patch.

Ack.

Oops. I 100% do that regularly... probably a bad habit.
If you do, it's ok, just make sure that you point out the stuff you DIDN'T fix in the newest patchset so the maintainer doesn't have to review it again.
Fixed the whitespace issue this started with.  Patches to make this pip installable have been pushed to dmtf.
Might be good to contribute a setup.py (or some other python packaging) upstream.  This is kind of atrocious.

I looked into it and tried to write some for what should've been "easy";  Didn't get very far because of the way they have their repo laid out is not very standard, and setuptools choked on it a bit.  It's for sure on my list to get back to so I can pip install these things locally at some point.  Agreed, this is awful.

I'm going to close this, even thought the PR isn't yet accepted, the latest patchset uses the setup.py and points to my PR, and Mike (the redfish-tools maintainer) seems amenable to it, so this should be solved.
This looks like really cool feature. Will there be a short README with instructions how to run it? I wonder if this will be enabled by default or there will be some additional setup steps.

I believe it will not be enabled by default since it will required python and other dependencies that most system might not want.

From my understanding, you just need to add

```
OBMC_IMAGE_EXTRA_INSTALL:append = " redfish-service-validator"
```
in `obmc-phosphor-image.bbappend`.


I think just running `openbmc-redfish-test` on the BMC itself should run the validator fully.

> Will there be a short README with instructions how to run it?

There's not really instructions per-se;  Once it's included in an images, it's literally just run the command and the defaults will "just work", but sure, I'm happy to write down those steps.

If it is as simple as running one command one line of info in README would be fine.

To run service validator log in into openbmc console and execute `redfish-service-validator`.

Information about adding EXTRA_INSTALL:append in case of missing executable would also be helpful, because on some platforms it might be disabled by default.

It should help people which are starting their adventure with openbmc.
Yep, I'll write a 2 sentence doc, but that would go in the docs folder, so I'm going to resolve this comment for now.  (Please reopen if you intended for me to add docs to this patch)

No need to review this just yet.  redfish-library added a dependency that I need to upstream to OE.  This is just pushed because I know people are using this patch as a starting point for development.
This appears to be resolved now?
Yep.  I'll remove it from the commit message on the next patch.
Shouldn't this go upstream to meta-oe?

To quote my last comment:
"No need to review this just yet.  redfish-library added a dependency that I need to upstream to OE.  This is just pushed because I know people are using this patch as a starting point for development"

This file is that dependency.

In short, yes.
Ack.  I must have missed it and/or forgotten it.
No worries;  Been there, done that.
Recipe has been submitted, now we play the waiting game.
